name: tris(3-methoxyphenyl)phosphine
Reason: 3-methoxyphenyl groups, when connected to a phosphine base, significantly increase the melting point due to the additional rigidity and molecular weight. Each methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, which raises the melting point by approximately +5°C. The phosphine base itself also contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C. The presence of three methoxy groups increases the melting point due to additional hydrogen bonding potential and molecular weight, estimated at around +90°C.
